Description: Fragment of lid of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bird or siren (feet and tail feathers remaining) to left; incised rosette and rising roundel as filling ornament; at right, part of undetermined decoration; below, two black lines above black-figure frieze consisting of lion (tail remaiing) to right; incised pendant rosette as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd was lost in WWII.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 315, no. 1357, pl. 175, no. 1357)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2089) (phase 2)
